summary: The International Nuclear Energy Financing Act of 2025 aims to promote nuclear energy development globally. It directs the Secretary of the Treasury to advocate for removing restrictions on nuclear energy financing at international financial institutions like the World Bank. The bill also calls for establishing Nuclear Energy Assistance Trust Funds within these institutions to provide financial and technical support for nuclear energy projects, focusing on technologies meeting high safety standards. The bill's provisions include a sunset clause after 10 years and mandates reports on progress.
